intro: Monogramma seminuda, commonly known as the slender monogramma, is a species of fern native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce numerous small, oblong spore-bearing leaves. The botanical structure of Monogramma seminuda reflects its adaptation to humid, low-light conditions, making it a common sight in subtropical and tropical regions.
